title: 'Khujli' vs 'abodh balak' jibe: Kharge and Nadda faceoff in Rajya Sabha as Parliament logjam drags on
Single spark could cause a fireball: 32-hour op that averted disaster on Pune–Mumbai Expressway
summary: A 32-hour hazardous materials operation successfully averted a potential propylene gas disaster on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway. Specialized teams tackled multiple leaks from an overturned tanker carrying 21,000 kg of flammable gas, employing a high-risk decanting strategy and multi-agency coordination to prevent a catastrophic explosion.

title: Mentally ill girl raped, impregnated; 16 rounded up for DNA tests, father turns out to be culprit
summary: Mumbai police arrested a father after DNA tests confirmed he impregnated his 20-year-old daughter, who has a mental illness. Hospital staff discovered her five-month pregnancy during a medical examination. The investigation, triggered by the hospital's report, involved DNA comparisons from multiple men, ultimately identifying the father as the sole positive match.

title: Cong digs out 2005 clip of Manmohan Singh to counter govt amid Parliament logjam
Kerala headmistress barred from school gate for wearing churidar instead of saree
summary: A headmistress was barred from entering her aided school in Kollam for wearing a churidar, sparking protests and police intervention. The school manager insisted on a saree, despite government orders permitting churidars. The headmistress, who filed a complaint, alleges ongoing harassment by the manager, who has faced prior misconduct allegations.

title: Google crosses $400 billion revenue mark for the first time; Elon Musk reacts
summary: Google achieved a historic milestone, surpassing $400 billion in annual revenue for the first time in its Q4 2025 earnings report. CEO Sundar Pichai highlighted strong momentum across Google Services and Google Cloud, with AI advancements like Gemini driving significant growth and user engagement. The company anticipates substantial capital expenditures for 2026 to meet escalating customer demand.

title: ‘Didn’t expect to be back ...’: Tilak Varma’s comeback lifts India’s WC mood
summary: Tilak Varma made a remarkable comeback from injury, scoring a quickfire 45 off 19 balls in India's T20 World Cup warm-up win against South Africa. Expressing gratitude for his accelerated recovery, Varma credited the BCCI and CoE, feeling immense support from the crowd. The team's aggressive batting energy inspired his free-flowing play, signaling readiness for the World Cup opener.

title: 'Limitless potential!': Sergio Gor hails India-US ties; points to high level talks
summary: India and the US are set to deepen their bilateral ties, with Ambassador Gor highlighting readiness for elevated engagement. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's recent meetings with US officials, including Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, covered trade, energy, defense, and critical minerals, signaling a robust economic and strategic partnership ahead.

title: Specialists back in vogue: India’s team management takes a U-turn ahead of T20 WC
summary: MS Dhoni's rare praise highlights India's formidable T20 World Cup squad, deemed 'one of the most dangerous teams.' A ruthless selection process and strategic pivots, particularly under coach Gautam Gambhir, have forged an immaculately balanced unit. With aggression as the core principle and specialists in key roles, Team India appears stronger than ever, poised to dominate.

title: Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
summary: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.

title: Woman detained for abusing Greater Noida condo residents over walking pet dog
summary: A Greater Noida woman was detained by police after a pet dog allegedly defecated in a common area, sparking a heated argument. Residents claim the owner used abusive language when confronted about designated pet zones. A viral video of the confrontation led to a formal complaint and the woman's questioning by Bisrakh police, who stated legal action would follow.

title: Space missions could be safer with plasma tunnel testing spacecraft's heat conditions while reentry
'Border 2' box office day 14: Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan film inches towards Rs 300 cr
summary: 'Border 2' continues its strong box office journey, crossing ₹291 crore despite a recent dip after its initial surge. The film, which saw a significant boost from the Republic Day holiday, is now earning single-digit figures in its second week. While it held its ground against 'Mardaani 3', the ensemble cast's film is showing signs of slowing down.

title: What did Microsoft's new Commercial CEO's company-wide memo told employees?
summary: Microsoft's Commercial CEO Judson Althoff has reshaped his leadership team, promoting four executives to senior vice president roles. This move aims to accelerate AI adoption and enhance agility, as the company navigates a significant AI platform shift. The restructuring focuses on tightening customer feedback loops and empowering faster decision-making to meet evolving market demands.

title: Man kicked, punched, beaten in Delhi for objecting to harassment of women
summary: A 26-year-old businessman was brutally assaulted in south Delhi's Mehrauli after he intervened to stop four men from harassing three women. The attackers beat him severely, even after he lost consciousness. Police have arrested all four accused, who have been charged under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Abhishek Bachchan at 50: Reinventing, staying motivated, why cynicism never won — Exclusive
summary: Abhishek Bachchan, marking 25 years in Bollywood, embraces reinvention as he turns 50.  Despite facing numerous flops and public scrutiny, he remains grounded, acknowledging his privilege while crediting his survival to merit.  He emphasizes the necessity of constant evolution to connect with new audiences and avoid becoming stale, a lesson learned from observing industry peers.

title: Fortnite v39.40 update: All new content and changes revealed
summary: Fortnite's v39.40 update arrives February 5, 2026. Players can expect Valentine's Day celebrations and new cosmetics. KPop Demon Hunters Wave 2 returns with new characters. Chappell Roan headlines Fortnite Festival Season 13. Shockwave Grenades will be unvaulted, while Crash Pad Jrs. are vaulted. This update brings fresh content and gameplay adjustments.

title: Pet shot twice for barking at another dog in UP; FIR against 2 men
Karnataka man attacked for accompanying Muslim woman, forced to record ‘love confession’
summary: In a troubling incident in Gangavathi, four Muslim youths have been apprehended following their alleged assault on salesman Venkatesh Avalamand. The salesman reported that after confronting him about his association with a Muslim woman, the youths invaded his privacy by checking his phone, demanding he profess love, and recording the encounter.

title: Birthday balloons explode inside lift in Mumbai’s Goregaon
summary: A young student, Himani Tapriya, sustained severe burns after dozens of gas-filled balloons exploded in a lift at Amol Tower, Goregaon. The incident occurred when a delivery man, Raju Kumar Mahato, entered the lift with the balloons. Police have registered a negligence case against the shop owner for failing to provide safety instructions to his employee, who also suffered injuries.

title: Monkey snatches baby in UP village, releases it in exchange for rotis
summary: Alert villagers in Amroha district rescued a one-and-a-half-month-old infant snatched by a monkey. The monkey grabbed the baby from a courtyard and climbed onto the roof. Villagers lured the animal away with rotis, allowing them to safely retrieve the child. Residents are demanding action against the increasing monkey menace.

title: Watch: Night of horror for Philippines as devastating fire leaves thousands homeless
summary: A devastating fire ravaged Bongao, southern Philippines, destroying over 1,000 homes and leaving thousands homeless. Fueled by strong winds and flammable materials, the blaze spread rapidly, forcing residents to flee by land and sea. Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire, which caused an estimated 17.5 million Philippine pesos in property damage.

title: Kids, elderly and patients left stuck for 32 hours on Pune–Mumbai Expressway
summary: A tanker carrying flammable propylene overturned on the Pune-Mumbai expressway, causing a 32-hour traffic disruption. Thousands of commuters, including patients and senior citizens, faced a harrowing ordeal with no food or water. Rescue operations and gas transfer caused significant delays, impacting transport services.

title: Bengaluru Metro ride set to get costlier again; fares may go up 5% from February 9
summary: Bengaluru commuters face another fare hike on Namma Metro, with a 5% increase expected from February 9th. This follows last year's significant price jump, despite public outcry. The Metro operator cites financial obligations, even reporting an operational profit but a wider net loss. Decisions on fare revisions rest with the BMRCL board.

title: Gurgaon shocker: Class 8 student raped, impregnated by neighbour
summary: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, a 14-year-old girl fell victim to a horrific crime when she was allegedly raped by her 19-year-old neighbor. The sad story unfolded in January after the young victim reported excruciating pain, prompting a visit to the doctor, who revealed she was two weeks pregnant.

title: Drunk techie strips naked outside Bangalore Club, blocks car, fights cops
summary: A US-based techie, Rajesh Anant, was denied entry to the Bangalore Club for being unaccompanied and inebriated. He later returned naked, blocked a car, and fought with security and police, leading to his father's one-month club suspension and his own ban.

title: No school since Covid: Ghaziabad sisters stayed away from society play areas too
summary: Three sisters died by suicide after years of isolation, with their lives consumed by K-pop and Korean dramas as an escape from parental disapproval and family stress. A recovered diary revealed deep resentment over perceived unfair objections to their interests and accusations of physical punishment, highlighting a tragic convergence of isolation and unmet emotional needs.

title: Bigg Boss OTT fame Chandrika's husband accuses her of extramarital affair
summary: Bigg Boss OTT fame Chandrika Dixit accused her husband Yugam Gera of cheating, sharing evidence of his alleged infidelity. In response, Yugam released a video claiming Chandrika has also been unfaithful, questioning her relationship with another man. Both have publicly shared their accusations and evidence.

title: Mahindra's massive Make In India push: 35,000 Scorpio Pik-Ups to be exported to Indonesia
summary: Under this partnership, Mahindra and Agrinas Pangan Nusantara aim to equip Koperasi with robust, reliable vehicles to ensure the effective, seamless flow of fresh supplies from farmers directly to the marketplace, thereby bridging the gap between producers and consumers.

title: Fourth-time lucky for Delhi? Jemimah set for key role as Mandhana’s RCB await WPL final
summary: Jemimah Rodrigues has transformed into a commanding Delhi Capitals captain, leading her team to the WPL final after a shaky start.  Despite RCB's league-stage dominance and final experience, the Capitals, with their in-form batting unit and resilient captain, arrive with significant momentum for the summit showdown.

title: India-US trade deal: What it means for economy, markets & Russian oil imports?
summary: India and the US have announced a framework for a bilateral trade deal to strengthen trade ties, under which the US will cut tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 50%. The Centre has clarified that agriculture and dairy remain protected, while sectors such as textiles, leather and gems may benefit.

title: 'Had to leave my marriage': Melinda hints at Bill Gates’ Epstein link as reason for divorce
summary: Melinda French Gates expressed deep sadness and exhaustion over newly released Epstein files that resurfaced painful memories from her marriage to Bill Gates. She emphasized her heartbreak for the victims and stated that her ex-husband and others involved need to answer for their actions, not her.

title: What is new in UPSC CSE 2026? No second chance for serving officers
summary: The Union Public Service Commission has tightened rules for the Civil Services Examination 2026. Serving IAS and IFS officers cannot reappear. IPS officers can only compete for other services. A one-time improvement chance is available for those allocated in 2026 or earlier. Resignation is mandatory for further attempts after this window.

title: Gold, silver price prediction: Precious metals on track for gains? Here's the outlook
summary: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold and silver prices have resumed their upward momentum after the recent crash, signalling bullish momentum, says Abhilash Koikkara, Head - Forex & Commodities, Nuvama Professional Clients Group. He shares his views on gold and silver:

title: 'Nothing new, New Delhi free to ... ': Kremlin on Trump's claims India will stop buying Russian oil
‘Korea was life’: Ghaziabad girls had rift with father over K-pop before deaths
summary: In a heart-wrenching incident in Ghaziabad, the lives of three young sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, ended tragically as they fell from their ninth-floor apartment. Eyewitnesses recounted seeing the eldest sister plunge first, with her younger siblings following shortly after.

title: IND vs SA warm-up: Ishan settles opener debate; Surya & Co. on the loose
summary: Ishan Kishan’s explosive warm-up knock against South Africa may have finally settled India’s long-running wicketkeeper debate. With Sanju Samson out of form and the World Cup around the corner, Kishan’s clarity, confidence, and dominance at the top make him the clear frontrunner. And come Saturday, he will walk out as Abhishek Sharma's opening partner against the USA in Mumbai.

title: 'During COVID, she kicked me out of the house’: R Madhavan on how Sarita pushed him back to work
summary: R Madhavan recently shared a candid and humorous anecdote about how his wife Sarita played a key role in pushing him back into work during the pandemic. What began as a light-hearted nudge eventually became a turning point, helping the actor reassess his mindset, reset after a four-year break from acting, and return with renewed focus—especially towards projects that genuinely excited him, including a steady shift to OTT platforms.

title: 'Gavu Pattadam': Men bite goats, leave them to die in ritual sacrifice during Jagtial temple jatara
summary: A brutal animal sacrifice involving around 50 goats, killed by biting their throats, has been reported from Jagtial district during the Bheemanna Jatara. Animal rights activists recorded the disturbing ritual, leading to an FIR against organizers under multiple acts. Despite being illegal, such sacrifices persist, with locals citing tradition and belief in wish fulfillment.

title: London-Bengaluru Fuel Switch Issue: UK regulator seeks Air India details; NGO flags probe risk
summary: The UK's aviation regulator has requested information from Air India regarding maintenance on a Boeing 787 after a fuel control switch issue was reported in London. While Air India conducted precautionary checks and found no further issues, an NGO has lodged a complaint, urging the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau to secure evidence and maintain its independence.

title: Rupee inches 7 paise to reach 90.40 against US dollar
summary: The Indian rupee opened marginally higher at 90.45 against the US dollar on Thursday, recovering slightly after a dip in the previous session. Mixed market sentiment prevails as traders await official confirmation of the India-US trade deal, with crude oil price volatility also influencing currency movements.

title: Ramadan 2026 in the UAE: Working hours, penalties and rules explained
summary: UAE residents and workers are excited for Ramadan 2026, with mandatory reduced working hours for private and government sectors. Employees can expect at least two fewer hours daily in private firms, while government offices will operate from 9 am to 2:30 pm on weekdays. These adjustments aim to balance work with fasting and spiritual observance.

title: Panneerselvam sparks row with ‘North Indians clean tables’ in Tamil Nadu remark; BJP hits back
summary: The BJP has strongly criticised a Tamil Nadu minister's remarks about North Indian migrant workers, calling them derogatory and part of a pattern by the ruling DMK to fuel social divisions. The party highlighted the minister's comments about migrants working in low-paying jobs and questioned the silence of opposition alliance leaders, deeming such statements dangerous amidst rising violence against workers.

title: Should Iran's supreme leader Khamenei be worried? Trump's response and a blunt warning
summary: President Trump issued a stern warning to Iran against restarting its nuclear program, threatening severe consequences if new facilities are established. He claimed US strikes had previously destroyed targeted nuclear sites, preventing Iran from accessing them and asserting that the country was close to developing a nuclear weapon.

title: IIT-Bombay student dies by suicide: ‘Masti, engineering & fun’ was his last Instagram caption
Injury scare for India before T20 WC as pacer limps off during warm-up clash
summary: Team India faces a worrying injury blow as pacer Harshit Rana limped off during a T20 World Cup warm-up against South Africa. This adds to concerns over Washington Sundar's fitness just before the tournament begins. Despite this, Tilak Varma impressed with an all-round performance, and India secured a 30-run victory.
